section1.title: What is ConvergENS?
section1.body:
ConvergENS is the organisation that brings together the engaged organisations and clubs of the École normale supérieure (ENS), in connection with student parties and unions.
It arose from a double frustration: on the one hand, often small organisation boards bending under the weight of volunteer work; on the other, new volunteers forced to choose between causes that speak to them just as much.
ConvergENS provides a shared space to follow each organization’s updates and keep the connection. From within the ENS, by coming together, we surface lines of convergence — and we also discuss the divides — across our struggles.

section2.title: How does ConvergENS work?
section2.body:
ConvergENS is not an umbrella structure over its members, but a organisation that brings them together. Organisations and clubs are the decision-makers and vote in the General Assembly on everything concerning the organisation (upcoming events, welcoming new members, etc.). Parties and unions are invited members: they contribute in particular to Agora (ConvergENS’ journal) and to its launch conferences.
To join ConvergENS, simply get involved in a member (or invited) organization and become its representative within the organisation.

section3.title: Our Objectives
section3.body:
Our main objective is to promote a horizontal education in citizenship—not only through the ballot box, but also through union, organisation, and party action.
To do this, we:

items.shareExperiences: organize experience-sharing sessions among volunteers to prevent activist burnout;
items.poolResources: pool our resources and carry shared advocacy (notably with the ENS leadership);
items.createSpaces: create inter-organization spaces for discussion and debate to share updates and coordinate.

Thus, the organisations and unions remain completely independent of the partisan organisations invited to take part in ConvergENS activities.

meta.title: Agora – The ConvergENS Journal
meta.description: Agora is the biannual review of the ConvergENS organisation: ecological, feminist, anti-racist and anti-colonialist perspectives rooted in activist practice.

banner.alt: Three copies of the newspaper Agora
banner.title: Agora
banner.subtitle: The ConvergENS Journal

about.p1: is a review to which all members and invited members of the ConvergENS organisation contribute.
about.p2: Published twice a year, it gives each organization the opportunity to shed light on a shared theme from its own standpoint: ecological, feminist, anti-racist and anti-colonialist struggles. Our editorial line is clear: rather than producing abstract or purely ideological discourse, we start from our activist practices and everyday difficulties to nourish a organisation reflection.
about.p3: Each issue is accompanied by a launch talk—a time for debate and public discussion of the texts.
